10:04 <mflorea> vmassol: currently there's no way to "hide" the WebHome in attachment link references, right? i.e. if you want to create a link to an attachment or if you want to insert an attached image you have to use WebHome, right?  
10:08 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <vmassol> hi mflorea  
10:09 <vmassol> hmm  
10:09 <vmassol> I don't know if Edy has done that or not  
10:09 <vmassol> checking doc  
10:11 <vmassol> doesn't say indeed  
10:11 <vmassol> could be a leftover  
10:12 <vmassol> let's ask Edy when he's connected  
10:13 <vmassol> mflorea: btw I'm implementing the new webjars url, I hope you're ok with the namespace-in-the-url solution  
10:13 <mflorea> he's just about the connect, I've asked him and he said that they (he and tmortagne I guess) have modified the attach: resource type to support space references  
10:14 <tmortagne> mflorea: AFAIK attachment reference resolution work like document, you can hide WebHome  
10:14 <lkrejci> has quit  
10:14 <tmortagne> it's using the same resolver for the document part basically  
10:14 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:16 <mflorea> ok, but this means you cannot point to a specific document, due to the way the fallback works, right?  
10:16 <tmortagne> not sure what you mean  
10:17 <tmortagne> you want to point to a not existing document ?  
10:17 <mflorea> i.e. attach:[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) could point to [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) and [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
10:17 <mflorea> both could exist  
10:18 <tmortagne> if you use [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) then it will target A.B document first, if A.B may exist and you actually mean A.B.WEbHome you have to use A.B.WebHome you don't really have a choice  
10:18 <tmortagne> nothing to do with attachments  
10:20 <tmortagne> or do you mean that you want [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) to never fallback on [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) ?  
10:22 <mflorea> I want to be sure that when the user selects an attachment to link to the link will point to that attachment and not a different one due to the fallbak. For this it seems the editor needs to output references with WebHome  
10:23 <mflorea> by editor I mean the CKEditor  
10:23 <tmortagne> the whole hiding WebHome thing is based on fallback system, if can't have both hidden WebHome and no fallback  
10:24 <tmortagne> so yes the editor you always serialize exact reference  
10:24 <tmortagne> but it's the same issue with links to documents, it's not something specific to attachments  
10:25 <tmortagne> and we already talked about that on the mailing list AFAIK  
10:25 <mflorea> for docs you can use the space: ref to target a WebHome page specifically  
10:26 <vmassol> I'm not sure I agree  
10:26 <tmortagne> you exchange WebHome for space which is pretty much the same level of complexity for basic user who is not supposed to know what a space is  
10:26 <vmassol> if the wysiwyg uses full ref then it's going to modify user-entered references  
10:26 <vmassol> and that's bad  
10:26 <vmassol> it's going to transform [[label>>A.B]] into [[label>>A.B.WebHome]] after the save  
10:27 <tmortagne> vmassol: why ? we are talking about new link or link explicitely modified by the WYSIWYG user here  
10:27 <vmassol> and users will see webhome (what we wanted to avoid)  
10:27 <mflorea> vmassol: links are modified only if you edit them  
10:27 <tmortagne> the source reference is in a metadata in the HTML so going trough the WYSIWYG don't loose it  
10:27 <vmassol> mflorea: sure, but the result is the same, no?  
10:27 <vmassol> users will get a WebHome  
10:28 <mflorea> if the user edits a link then yes  
10:28 <mflorea> but this is an explicit action on the link  
10:28 <vmassol> I think we have a jira issue already for this  
10:28 <vmassol> yup: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13083#  
10:29 <mflorea> the user may select a different page to link to, which is terminal so we may have to change the reference type  
10:29 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes this is what I was talking about and which is about documents  
10:29 <vmassol> yes it's not related to attachments, I was commenting on the "so yes the editor you always serialize exact reference"  
10:30 <vmassol> I don't know the solution  
10:30 <vmassol> but I know it's going to be a problem for users  
10:30 <vmassol> actually I rasied this issue because a user raised it to me first  
10:30 <tmortagne> yes this is also what I said, we started the discussion we did not concluded :)  
10:30 <vmassol> yep  
10:30 <tmortagne> I just wanted to not start a new discussion for attachment since it's the same  
10:32 <vmassol> agreed  
10:33 <mflorea> ok, so for now there's no way for the editor to hide WebHome in attachment references  
10:38 <tmortagne> is you talk about space:, yes there is no space: support in  attachment resource references  
10:38 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:38 <mflorea> ok  
10:39 <tmortagne> s/is/if/  
10:40 <tmortagne> better ask Enygma`to be sure but I can't find any  
10:58 <Enygma`> yes, attach: resources are directly handled as untyped link references  
10:59 <Enygma`> no support for attach:space: / attach:doc:  
10:59 <Enygma`> since we did not take that route

13:44 <acotiuga> Hello  
13:51 <vmassol> hi  
13:52 <acotiuga> I'm working on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13318 and I would need to add a new boolean property (perSpace) to the XWiki.ConfigurableClass in order to use it in the query that gets all the applications configurations  
13:53 <acotiuga> So far, this query seems to return results only when the configureGlobally is 1: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/7392653655d1a8524c67851393b0ac16b07974f5/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-administration/xwiki-platform-administration-ui/src/main/resources/XWiki/ConfigurableClassMacros.xml#L109  
13:54 <acotiuga> And there is no way to configure an installed application at space level  
13:55 <acotiuga> Of course, I could add a new application manually in the {     'id' : 'applications',     'children' : []   } but I would avoid this solution because wouldn't be a general solution  
13:57 <acotiuga> WDYT?  
13:57 <vmassol> I think you need to majke a proposal first  
13:58 <vmassol> what I understand if that you want to modify the configurable class feature  
13:58 <vmassol> to add a new feature to it  
13:58 <vmassol> that requires a proposal and a jira issue  
13:58 <vmassol> do you have this already?  
13:58 <vmassol> (maybe I missed them)  
13:58 <acotiuga> no, I just asked now here  
13:59 <acotiuga> I'm looking to see also if there could be other applications that would need a space level configuration  
13:59 <vmassol> so configurable class doesn't support dusplaying at space admin level?  
13:59 <vmassol> \*displaying  
13:59 <vmassol> we do have a several already  
13:59 <vmassol> but maybe they're not using configurable class  
13:59 <vmassol> (which was introduced after them probably)  
13:59 <vmassol> we have: rights, skin, etc  
14:00 <vmassol> so indeed I agree that we need an option to display an Admin UI entry for a given space  
14:00 <acotiuga> no, they're not using configurable class  
14:00 <vmassol> at space level I mean  
14:00 <vmassol> that would be useful anyway  
14:01 <vmassol> I wonder why cjd hasn't done it, maybe didn't get the time  
14:01 <vmassol> (cjd coded the configurable class stuff)  
14:01 <acotiuga> there are some applications configured at space level but they are rather hardcoded that dynamically generated  
14:01 <vmassol> yes ultimately we need to convert them to configurable class  
14:02 <acotiuga> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-administration/xwiki-platform-administration-ui/src/main/resources/XWiki/AdminSheet.xml#L60  
14:02 <vmassol> (we need to move everything to configurable class ideally)  
14:02 <acotiuga> I gave you the place where the configurations are set  
14:02 <vmassol> yes I know  
14:52 <vmassol> mflorea/tmortagne: ok to merge my fix for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13276 in 7.4.3?

14:53 <vmassol> but since we need it for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/CKEDITOR-53
